intro: Bunium latilobum, commonly known as the broad-lobed fennel, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. Native to Central Asia, this plant thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or arid soils. The plant has a strong, aromatic scent and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its seeds are edible and can be used as a spice, similar to fennel.
